articles.description: In a consultation paper, Sebi proposed that companies with a post-issue capital of above  ₹10,000 crore will be required to initially sell only 5% of the company to the public
articles.content: The markets regulator on Friday proposed to reduce the size of large initial public offerings (IPOs), a move that would make it easier for state-run Life Insurance Corp. of India to comply with initi… [+3552 chars]
